oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Example of submission of original and duplicate copies of the return of ordnance and ordnance stores documents

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Robinson, Wingate Truitt, 1832-1903; United States -- Army -- Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, 5th; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Regimental histories; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Regimental histories
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Three items: envelope with notation by 1st Lieutenant W. T. Robinson, "To file away for Safe Keeping for future reference should it be necessary;" Circular No. 52 -- Series of 1863 entitled "Invoice of Ordnance and Ordance Stores."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Ordnance Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Original and duplicate copies of the Return of the Ordnance and Ordnance Stores documents for Company K, 5th Tennessee Cavalry Volunteers, to the Chief of Ordnance, March 31, 1865. The Chief of Ordnance was charged with supervising the arms and ammunition in the hands of the men, reporting waste or damage, and returning the surplus to the Ordnance Bureau.
